alert.note: Alert for South Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 18 at 4:21AM PST until January 19 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation. Total snow accumulations up to 15 inches and ice accumulations of up to one half of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph near the Columbia River Gorge. * WHERE...South Washington Cascades. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be difficult. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Primarily snow is expected above 3000 feet, with primarily freezing in the valleys. Gusty winds with falling snow may reduce visibility at times. The combination of ice and snow may make travel difficult.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
